data.title: Lunch getaway
data.text: Had lunch with my wife. She had her usual bean burrito and I the pork pupusas. A little bland but still very good and filling. The service was prompt and they made special fresh brewed iced tea.  Because the tea they have is from a machine. Machine tea is, well lets just say I don't like it.

data.title: Passing though Madera
data.text: Sat at the bar. Great happy hour for drinks and appetizers. Had one of each type of taco, all were delicious. The margarita was awesome. Cool atmosphere, definitely would recommend.

data.title: Unexpected Surprise
data.text:
Came here on the advice of motel receptionist and what a great find. The bar is fantastic with friendly server and terrific atmosphere. Great margarita's too.

Went to the restaurant area for dinner and had a friendly server who looked after us with quick efficient service. Food was top notch and good size portions.

Prices were excellent so good value for money. 
Would definitely return and highly recommended. Great Place

data.title: I love going to this place.
data.text: I love going to this place.  Great casual dining.  We take customers there all the time.  The food is excellent!

data.title: Pork carnitas - my favorite!!
data.text: Burrito King offers a wide variety of dishes from soup to dinner plates.  My favorite is the pork carnitas dinner plate!!  The burritos are huge!!  The rice and beans are the best in town!!  We go back again and again!!

data.title: Great family run restaurant
data.text: A long time Madera staple. You can't go wrong here. We love coming here and enjoying the family atmosphere. The food is delicious every time. Mike always orders the Caldo de Cameron and I get the chili relenos. Hot tortillas and cold coronas are a must. Always enjoy speaking with the family and their great customer service.

data.title: Good food & service.
data.text: If you like good Mexican foor at a reasonable price, this is it.  I have been a customer for many years.  Always good food and service

data.title: Family Dining with Mexican Flavors
data.text:
This is one of our go-to restaurants, particularly when we're in the mood for Mexican cuisine. Some of the dishes are a bit Americanized (or so I'm told by my friends who have come from Mexico), but all in all, it's great flavors in good quantities. 

The staff is always friendly and welcoming, and they treat strangers like friends and regulars like family. I've ordered many different items from the dinner menu on different visits and I've never had a bad meal or bad service at Burrito King. In addition to all of that, the prices are extremely reasonable!

data.title: Been coming here for years!!
data.text: The best salsa and refried beans in town!!  Used to get them with a bag of chips for breakfast!!  The carnitas is wonderful; the tacos and tostadas are great!

data.title: Best mexican food in town
data.text: Always good. Fresh food. Family owned and operated. Great service. So many of my favorites on the menu.

data.title: Good service
data.text: The staff was great. They provided great service. The food was also good and I would definitely go there again.

data.title: HORRIBLE SERVICE, tasteless/rotten food, disgusting atmosphere
data.text: I would NEVER have selected this place if it were up to me because it looked pretty run-down and disgusting from the outside, but I was with clients who picked it. I ordered chili verde ala cart, a side of guacamole and a single fish taco and the server said "Geez you must be really hungry!" I was dumbfounded but since I was with clients I did not say anything. When she left one of my clients said "That was incredibly rude." I agreed. When the food came it had absolutely NO FLAVOR! How can you possibly make chili verde with no flavor?!?! The guac was kind of creamy, like something white had been added to it...it was a weird light green and again had NO FLAVOR. The chips they served us were stale and my fish taco had an off-putting taste so I only had one bite. WORST FOOD EVER!!! After we ate one of my clients asked for the menu and questioned why her bill was $6.95 instead of $4.95. The waitress argued with her about what she ordered and said you ordered this not that. And my client said "I pointed to what I wanted on the menu and showed you, you brought me the wrong food and charged me more for it." Another lady comes out and starts arguing with her as well saying "If the wrong food came out then why didn't you say something?" The deal was that she had never had this before so did not know what it would look like. They didn't care, they just argued. RUDE SERVICE! HORRIBLE, DISGUSTING, TASTELESS FOOD! If there was a ZERO rating I would have given them a 0. THEY SUCK!!!

data.title: Authentic Mexican Food
data.text: I eat here a couple times a month. The food is very good and the prices are reasonable. They have a bar area if you just want a cold beer and some chips and salsa. Has a nice dining area and friendly staff.

data.title: Good Burritos
data.text: I stopped at this seemingly pretentiously named restaurant, but was pleasantly surprised by the yummy burrito I had.  Their Al Pastor burrito was seriously one of the best I've had!  My server was good about coming around to keep my drink refilled.  They were a bit stingy on the chips initially, but she brought me some more.  The interior appeared new or recently re-done and looked like a fun place to have a party.  The only downside was that for a quick lunch, it was an expensive burrito.  In Madera, I would expect it be under $12 and with tip I was closer to $15.

data.title: Good Mexican Food
data.text: I went there for a birthday celebration and the food was great. The staff was also very attentive to everything we needed.

data.title: Burrito King - Madera Ca.
data.text: Have been going to Burrito King for over 20 years. This is their third location in Madera. There food always fresh and Hot. Friendly service and good prices with senior citizen and children meue available.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: This place gets a bad rap locally and I don't know why. We've been going every Friday night for their enchilada special. We never have to wait for a table, the food is excellent and piping hot, chips and salsa are fresh, and the price can't be beat....  Haven't been disappointed yet!!

data.title: Must Try Chili Rellano
data.text: Family success story!  Food is generally terrific.  Week nights can be a bit off; I think because of the cook on duty.  Service is usually very good and very cheerful.  Food is hot.  Lunch time is busy, but they get the job done while serving delicious food.  There is a popular bar just off the dining room.  We don't mind the noise in the evening, but if you would, ask to be served in the dining room at the entrance of the restaurant and you won't even notice.  This is one of our usual haunts when we are looking for some hot and consistent Mexican food.  My husband swears their Chili Rellanos are the best!
